name: multiparous
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
medical, biology having given birth one or more times before in the past: Multiparous women usually have shorter labours than primiparous women. The study consisted of 23 multiparous and 16 primiparous Holstein cows. Compare
primiparous
biology producing more than one young animal at the same time: While many domestic animals such as pigs, cats, and dogs are multiparous, horses and cows are not.
More examplesFewer examples413 lambs were born from multiparous ewes. The female hamsters in the study were divided into three groups: (1) nulliparous young; (2) nulliparous adult (no pregnancies); and (3) multiparous adult (2-4 pregnancies)Multiparous women were no more likely to answer these questions correctly than primiparous women.All the females in the study were multiparous.
